text:
Hi guys, can you confirm if I need only one dynamic page to handle both the listing page and individual pages for a HubDB table entry?

I want to achieve this URL structure for the list and individual pages:

<http://abc.com/recipes|abc.com/recipes> (listing)
<http://abc.com/recipes/salad|abc.com/recipes/salad>
<http://abc.com/recipes/potatoes|abc.com/recipes/potatoes>

Let me know. thank you!
Hi <@U079QC6R6KT>, that's correct. You'll have just 1 template and page with that template. And in the page settings you'll choose your hubDB table as the data source.

Hello <@U03AKL6Q1B2>

Looking at settings, I can see Tools -> Content -> Pages.  This gives me access to say integrate with GA4.  From here I can select the HubSpot managed domain.  It also allows me to select the subdomain ( which again is hosted outside of HubSpot )

Now I can go to Account Setup -> Tracking & Analytics -> Tracking Code and I see a tab called Advanced Tracking.  When looking at this list, I can see my subdomain identified with a type = Hosted - but I don’t think that is correct since the Sub Domain is hosted by SAP.

From my understanding, what I need to do is copy the code snippet that is on the Tracking Code and embedded that into my subdomain then it will send to HubSpot Analytic information as well as sending info to GA4 ( note that both HubSpot Hosted site as well as SAP Hosted site are using the same GA4 tag id.

So under Tools -> Content - Domains & URLs should I remove the subdomain that is hosted by SAP?  Should I remove Shopify hosted sites as well?

Hi <@U070T6A705B>, please only post any career self promotion in <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs>. Self promotion in other channels goes against our community code of conduct. I’m going to delete this post in the meantime. Thanks!
